summary: The Reliable Rail Service Act of 2025 aims to ensure rail carriers provide efficient and reliable transportation services. It amends section 11101 of title 49 of the United States Code, focusing on the shipper's needs for timely and efficient service. The bill outlines factors the Board will consider when evaluating service quality, including operational changes, employment reductions, equipment availability, and adherence to service requirements. It also mandates expedited proceedings for addressing service violations and establishes timeframes for resolving disputes.  The bill seeks to define and enforce adequate service standards, transit times and other related objectives.
